Tutorials
=========

Comprehensive step-by-step guides that walk through complete workflows and real-world scenarios.
These tutorials are designed to help you learn TanaT systematically by combining multiple concepts into practical examples.

    03-real_data/mimic
    03-real_data/mooc

Getting Started with Synthetic Data
-----------------------------------

Generate synthetic data to explore TanaT's capabilities:

* :doc:`Sequence Simulation <01-simulation/simulation_sequence>` - Create and configure synthetic sequences
* :doc:`Trajectory Simulation <01-simulation/simulation_trajectory>` - Generate multi-sequence trajectories

Working with Your Data
----------------------

Master data manipulation and configuration:

* :doc:`Sequence Data Wrangling <02-data_wrangling/data_wrangling_sequence>` - Filter, transform, and prepare your sequences
* :doc:`Trajectory Data Wrangling <02-data_wrangling/data_wrangling_trajectory>` - Filter, transform, and prepare your trajectories
* :doc:`Metadata Management <04-metadata/metadata_management>` - Configure feature types and settings
* :doc:`Type Conversions <05-type_conversions/sequence_conversions>` - Convert between different sequence representations


Real-World Applications
-----------------------

Apply TanaT to actual datasets:

* :doc:`MIMIC Dataset Analysis <03-real_data/mimic>` - Analyze electronic health records from MIMIC-IV
* :doc:`MOOC Student Activity Analysis <03-real_data/mooc>` - Explore learner activity sequences from Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs)

*Ideal for learning TanaT systematically and understanding how components work together.*
